result.execSummary:
The defendant Zackary Damion Hoste was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Per Judge Elizabeth Rohl July 22, 2022 - Sentence to commence once in custody.

to Revoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction

03:36 PM Defendant Zachary Damion Hoste in Court pro se.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court signs Order revoking Deferred Judgment Agreement.  Court notes request for attorney at last hearing, he states he wishes to proceed pro se.  Court questions Defendant, advises of right to Counsel.  Defendant waives.  Court finds that Defendant knowingly, freely, and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  ADA Walker states position.  Requests 3 years Probation, Restitution of $2883.82 and $161.83 in 14CM215.  Notes Restitution of $691.91 was paid in 16CF237 (Co-Defendant).  Defendant declines statement.  Court sentences Defendant, W/H.  Court orders 3 years Probation.  $2353.74 restitution (includes $161.83 on 14CM215).  $518 court costs, DNA sample.    Appeal rights are given to the defendant.  Adjourned at 3:55 PM
Sentencing hearing on August 7, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

11:54 AM Defendant Zachary Damion Hoste in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant rqquests to have an attorney. Atty Walker: reschedule to allow Defendant to get an attorney. If Defendant pays the restitution the sentencing hearing would not be necessary. Court encourages the Defendant to get the restitution paid. Reset this matter and Defendat must attend with an attorney. 11:57
Sentencing hearing on June 10, 2019 at 11:45 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Zachary Damion Hoste in court via phone.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to revoke DJOC. Walker: restitution was part of the DJOC and no payments have been received. Def agrees to making no payments. Court grants motion to revoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction but stay the entry of judgment of conviction until the sentencing.  Def provides current address.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2019 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Zachary Damion Hoste appears by telephone in court with attorney Adam P Nero.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan  Plead guilty and be put on DJOC which includes $ 2883.82 restitution jt and sev.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   DEF PLEADS GUILTY  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and withholds the judgment of conviction . The defendant has not signed the DJOC The Judge exams the defendant regarding his wish to sign the DJOC. The defendant states that he wants the Judge to print his name and the Judge will sign his name for him.  The court approves the DJOC and signs the paperwork.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant  Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to count 1 at preliminary hearing.  The bond will continue as ordered.  Set Pre Trial Conference.

3:13 p.m.  Defendant Zachary Damion Hoste in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan calls Investigator Peter Koch.  O'Sullivan examines Koch.  Koch identifies defendant.  Bub cross-examines Koch.  O'Sullivan does redirect.  No re-cross by Bub.  Court examines Koch.  Bub gives argument.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
